column1: There is  no complaint by the  Appellant that the learned trial Judge did not
adequately directed  the jury how  to  evaluate evidence for  its credibility and  the

weightage 
they  should  be  attaching 
to 
them 
if  they 
found 
the  evidence 
is

credible.  In  fact,  as  noted  above, 
the  learned 
trial  Judge  had  adequately  and

correctly  directed 
the  jury  on  evaluation  of  credibility  of  witnesses  and 
the

applicable 
tests 
in  evaluating  evidence,  and, 
in  addition,  had  drawn 
their
attention to  the inconsistencies pointed out by the Appellant.
